content: the two needles with the picked up sts so that you have an equal number of sts on each needle your round now begins at the bottom of the foot gusset row 1 knit until 3 sts are left on needle # 1 k2tog k1 knit across needles # 2 and 3 knit 3 sts on needle # 4 and pass second st over third knit the remaining sts on needle # 4 row 2 knit all sts repeat these row until you have 12 14 sts on all needles foot continue in stockinette stitch until foot measures 20 22 cm toe decreases womens size *k4 k2tog* until the end of the round k4 rounds *k3 k2tog* until the end of the round k3 rounds *k2 k2tog* until the end of the round k2 rounds *k1 k2tog* until the end of the round k1 round k2tog until the end of the round mens size *k5 k2tog* until the end of the round k 5 rounds continue as with the womens size you now have eight sts left cut the yarn and thread it through the remaining sts twice weave in ends you now have a sock abbreviations k - knit p- purl st - stitch sts - stitches ws - wrong side k2tog - knit two stitches together p2tog - purl two stitches together the math even though the traditional norwegian way is to knit these socks with dk weight yarn they can be knit with all sorts of yarn if you want to do the k2 p2-cuff you need to make sure that your total number of sts can be divided by four the heel flap is knit over half of the number of your stitches when you make the sections for the heel decrease each section should be roughly one third of your sts the outer sections need to have an equal number of stitches when decreasing for the toe make sure you have an equal number of sts on your needles it s best if you can decrease twice per needle if you for instance have 16 sts per needles you can k6 k2tog twice per needle the number of rounds between each decrease round equals the number of sts between each decrease on the preceding decrease round
